data.title: units should pick new targets when a unit enters their minimum range
data.body:
Played a game and observed that the MLRS (artillery) unit was shooting at incoming infantry. When the infantry approached within the minimum range (3), the MLRS stopped shooting. It kept moving around to face the infantry, as if trying to fire at it, but didn't. 

There were other infantry further away, further than the minimum range, but the MLRS did not fire upon them. Instead the MLRS just kept "locked on" the infantry that was too close and kept getting closer, while ignoring the other targets that it could have hit.

It would be good if when a unit enters their minimum range, they would just pick another target which they could hit.

I think that removing Bibs from modded maps causes game crashes...
(Did this in Version 20130330)

data.title: game crash when communication center is destroyed.

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
When ion cannon destroyed my command center (which gives you the Air Strike support power), the game crashed. Doesn't happen in single player when you destroy your own this way. May not happen in all cases.

It is that I had my cursor over the airstrike icon after the communications center was destroyed. 

Managed to reproduce bug in next game. After opponent destroyed my communications center, I quickly moved my cursor over the airstrike icon. It crashed, but I'm not sure if maybe it started crashing before I moved the cursor there. 
Normally when you mouseover the airstrike icon it gives you some info. When I moved my mouse over, no info popped up. 

exception.log:

```
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Sequence contains no elements
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.First[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source)
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.SupportPowerManager.SupportPowerInstance.get_Info()

   at OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager, Viewport viewPort)
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

data.title: Remove Turret and PVecFloat cruft.
data.body:
These changes convert contrails / aircraft smoke / rotors / spinners / husk particles to world coordinates, and then removes the old Turret and PVecFloat types.

The only potentially controversial change is husks, where I have changed the throw logic to use a simple cubic ease instead of trying to emulate real physics.

data.title: Unload direction for APC, Chinook, etc.
data.body:
It would be good if units would unload in a given direction when unloading, instead of just always towards the northwest. 
Chinook and apc usually open their doors towards the south, so it makes sense that the infantry should exit in that direction, too. It would be good if units would exit in a direction specified by the vehicle rules.

data.title: mcv crate; cloak delay; AI... minor changes
data.body:
MCV crate set to 0. This will be at the very least until there is a way to delay good units from showing up early game.
Cloak delay raised to 90 since it re-cloaks fast. This is because currently the stealth tank starts countdown while still in "attack mode", after the last missile was fired. Should be changed again to 1-2 seconds after  https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2898 is implemented.
Added hard AI.

data.title: Fix the bit-rotted tooltips of fake buildings
data.body: as although they are unused, the yaml should stay valid.

data.title: Additional Spy Functionality
data.body:
Spies should be able to detect and kill each other with their silenced pistols (Spy vs Spy/counterintelligence). A Spy only attacks in this way if it's disguised as an allied unit (or undisguised), and not an enemy one to avoid blowing its cover.

As per the following thread:

http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=16145

As an alternative to these infiltration effects, you can have Spies place remotely detonated explosives in buildings it infiltrates, which also includes production facilities, power plants, super weapons, tech centres and defensive structures (takes about as long as an Engineer capture to set explosives), reemerging after the explosives are set. You gain sight of the infiltrated structure. The Spy can 'deploy' in order to detonate all placed explosives, which instantly destroys the buildings they're planted in after a short delay (~3 seconds). This is similar to capabilities he demonstrated in Soviet Mission 3 from the original campaign. This effect is in addition to existing infiltration effects for the Radar Dome and Ore Refinery. Just before the buildings detonate, the victimized player will hear the triggering Spy proclaim: "For king and country" in his suave Connery voice.

If the Spy is killed before it can detonate its explosives, those explosives become harmless, and the Spy's controller loses sight of the structures it has infiltrated.

Spies can have their price increased (+100%) to compensate for this increased versatility. To help keep them useful for stealing credits, you could reimburse 50% of their cost on infiltration of Ore Refineries.

data.body: It won't even build on the desert maps.

data.title: cloak should engage after unit stops attacking
data.body:
A unit has a delay until its cloak engages. The countdown starts after the last shot was fired. But this doesn't work very well. Instead, it should count from the time that the unit stops "attacking" (has attack orders), as opposed to when the last shot was fired. The behavior is much better this way, and it prevents a unit with a slow reload time but fast recloak time from cloaking in between shots. 
It is also the default behavior from C&C 95.
